<h3 class="heading A-TYP22L-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="pp_tools_heading_9">
    Eligibility
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_tools_richtext_7" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To apply for our Wealth Goal Insurance Plan III, you'll need to meet both of these requirements:</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>the insured person is aged between 15 days after birth and 70 years<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-policyanniversarydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">1</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 1</span></a></sup> , depending on the premium payment terms you select</li>
 <li>meet our criteria for nationality (country/region/territory), address and residency, which are subject to change from time to time</li>
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_tools_richtext_8" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC Wealth Goal Insurance Plan III is a long-term participating life insurance plan with a savings element underwritten by HSBC Life (International) Limited ("HSBC Life"). It is not equivalent or similar to bank deposit. Policyholders are subject to HSBC Life's credit risk and early surrender loss.</p>
</div></div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">These additional benefits will be included in the policy at no extra cost.</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li><strong>Additional lump sum payout for accidental death<br> </strong>If the insured person passes away in an accident before the policy term ends or they reach age<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-policyanniversarydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">1</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 1</span></a></sup> 80, whichever is earlier, the beneficiaries will get an extra 30% of the total basic plan premium paid<sup><a href="#fn-totalbasicplanpremium" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">9</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 9</span></a></sup> on top of the death benefit payable as an additional accidental death benefit<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-additionalaccidentaldeathbenefit-wgip" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">10</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 10</span></a></sup>.</li>
 <li><strong>Pause premium payments if you're unemployed<br> </strong>If you are unemployed for at least 30 consecutive days before the age<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-policyanniversarydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">1</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 1</span></a></sup> of 65, our unemployment benefit<sup><a href="#fn-unemploymentbenefitwgip" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">11</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 11</span></a></sup> gives you an extended grace period of up to 365 days on your premium payments without affecting the insured person's full protection under the policy.</li>
 <li><strong>Financial support if you are incapacitated</strong><br> With our Incapacity Protection Service<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-incapacity-service" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">3</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 3</span></a></sup>, you can designate an immediate family member, so that in the event you are diagnosed as physically or mentally incapacitated, your designated immediate family member can make a one-time partial withdrawal from the policy on your behalf, as an immediate financial support to cover any medical expenses.</li>
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_tools_richtext_13" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This plan offers four death benefit settlement options<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-death-benefit" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">12</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 12</span></a></sup>. The beneficiaries<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-death-benefit" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">12</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 12</span></a></sup> listed will receive the death benefit as either:</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>a lump sum payment; or,</li>
 <li>annual instalments paid over 10, 20 or 30 years; or,</li>
 <li>first payment in a lump sum, followed by annual instalments over the tenor (2-30 years) chosen by you; or,</li>
 <li>annual instalments followed by a lump sum payment at the designated age of the beneficiary as specified by you.</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The policyholder can choose which settlement option they prefer at the time of their application or make the request after the policy has been issued. For more details, please refer to the <a href="#how-to-apply" data-pid="PWS_HK_EN_G15776_1">product brochure</a>.</p>
</div></div>

            <ol class="A-TYPS6R-RW-DEV footnotes-list without-bottom-padding"><li><div id="fn-insurance-policyanniversarydefinition" tabindex="-1">This refers to the policy anniversary at which the insured person or the policyholder will be of the specified age on their next birthday. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-cashvaluein30years" tabindex="-1">'Cash value' is calculated using the current assumed investment returns. It includes projected guaranteed cash value and projected special bonus which is non-guaranteed. The rate of return as shown above is therefore not guaranteed and is shown for illustration only. In this example, it is assumed that the insured person is a 40-year-old male paying an annual premium of USD40,000 for 3 years—and his return after 30 years. In conclusion, the actual cash value under the policy at a future point in time may be higher or lower than the amount quoted in this example. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-incapacity-service" tabindex="-1">While the policy is in force, you may choose your Designated Person and specify the Designated Percentage (10% to 50% of the aggregate cash value), by submitting a written request to us in a form as prescribed by us and subject to our prevailing rules and conditions, without any policy administrative charges. For details, please refer to the Incapacity Protection Service flyer. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-egip-withdrawal" tabindex="-1">Starting from the 3rd policy anniversary or when the policy is fully paid at the end of the premium payment period (whichever is later), if there is no indebtedness<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-egip-indebtedness" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">13</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 13</span></a></sup>, you may request to withdraw cash value from this policy in annual or monthly frequency. Please refer to section "Product Summary" of this product brochure for more details. </div></li><li><div id="fn-policylockin" tabindex="-1"><p>After your 20th policy year, you may be able to lock in a portion of the net cash value if there are no outstanding policy loans or premiums.</p>
<p>The amount you choose to lock in is guaranteed upon exercising the policy value management option. It will be allocated to the policy value management balance to accumulate at a non-guaranteed interest rate which will be adjusted from time to time at HSBC Life's discretion. Being able to choose this option is subject to minimum amount requirements on both the:</p>
<p>-net cash value to be allocated per transaction</p>
<p>-policy amount after exercising this option</p>
<p>These requirements may be determined by HSBC Life from time to time without prior notice to the policyholder. For details, please see the product brochure.</p>
 </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-changeoflifeinsured" tabindex="-1">Each policyholder is entitled to the change of life insured of policy for unlimited times after the first policy year or after the end of the premium payment period provided all premiums are fully paid when due, whichever is later. Change of life insured is subject to evidence of insurability and approval by HSBC Life which is based on the underwriting conditions of the life insured. Any such request will be assessed on case-by-case basis and is at our discretion, with consideration of multiple factors, including but not limited to the change in underlying claim risk, change in policy term, latest economic outlook; and is at our discretion. </div></li><li><div id="fn-paymentmode" tabindex="-1">If you choose the monthly payments mode for a policy year, please note that your total premiums payable for that policy year will be higher than that in the annual payment mode. </div></li><li><div id="fn-maxpremiumamount" tabindex="-1">The maximum total premium amount for pending guaranteed approval/simplified underwriting applications and in-force policies (per insured person) may differ and is subject to the insured person's insurance age. The total premium amount refers to the total premium amount of the policy as determined by HSBC Life. For details of the underwriting requirements, please contact HSBC branch staff. HSBC Life reserves the right to accept or decline any applications for this policy based on the information provided by the insured person and/or policyholder during their enrolment. </div></li><li><div id="fn-totalbasicplanpremium" tabindex="-1">The total basic plan premiums paid refers to the total amount of premiums due under your basic plan—whether or not actually paid—as of the date of death for the insured person. Please refer to the policy provisions for detailed terms and conditions. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-additionalaccidentaldeathbenefit-wgip" tabindex="-1">The additional accidental death benefit will terminate when the insured person reaches the age<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-policyanniversarydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">1</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 1</span></a></sup> of 80 or upon the payout of this benefit or when the policy is terminated (whichever is earlier), subject to a maximum benefit limit of USD3,000,000 or its equivalent per insured person across all additional accidental death benefit issued by HSBC Life. Please refer to the policy provisions of the supplementary benefits for detailed terms and conditions of coverage and exceptions. </div></li><li><div id="fn-unemploymentbenefitwgip" tabindex="-1">The unemployment benefit is applicable to policyholders aged<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-policyanniversarydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">1</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 1</span></a></sup> between 19 and 64 who hold a Hong Kong Identity Card. This benefit will terminate when the policyholders attains the age<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-policyanniversarydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">1</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 1</span></a></sup> of 65 or all due premiums have been paid or the policy is terminated (whichever is earlier). Such benefit is not applicable to single premium policy. Please refer to the policy provisions of the supplementary benefits for detailed terms and conditions of coverage and exceptions. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-death-benefit" tabindex="-1">The death benefit settlement option 2, 3 and 4 are only applicable to policies without any assignment. Option 3 and 4 are available only to the policy with single beneficiary. Please refer to the policy provisions for detailed terms and conditions. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-egip-indebtedness" tabindex="-1">Indebtedness means the sum of all outstanding policy loans or automatic premium loans advanced in accordance with the Policy, any accrued interest on such loans, and any outstanding premiums or payments under this policy. </div></li></ol>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_rel_richtext_1" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">HSBC Wealth Goal Insurance Plan III is a long-term participating life insurance plan with a savings element underwritten by HSBC Life (International) Limited ("HSBC Life") which is authorised and regulated by the Insurance Authority ("IA") to carry on long-term insurance business in the Hong Kong SAR. It is not a bank deposit or bank savings plan. Please refer to the product brochure for detailed features and the policy provisions for the detailed terms and conditions.</p>
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">HSBC Life is incorporated in Bermuda with limited liability, and is one of the HSBC Group's insurance underwriting subsidiaries. The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited ('HSBC') is registered in accordance with the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41 of the Laws of Hong Kong) as an agency of HSBC Life for the distribution of life insurance products in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.  This product is a product of HSBC Life but not HSBC and it is intended only for sale in the Hong Kong SAR. If the policyholder discontinues and / or surrenders the insurance plan in the early policy years, the amount of the benefit he / she will get back may be considerably less than the amount of the premium he / she has paid. Your benefit is subject to the credit risk of HSBC Life. Your premiums paid will form part of HSBC Life's assets. You do not have any rights or ownership over any of those assets. Your recourse is against HSBC Life only.</p>
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">In respect of an eligible dispute (as defined in the Terms of Reference for the Financial Dispute Resolution Centre in relation to the Financial Dispute Resolution Scheme) arising between HSBC and you out of the selling process or processing of the related transaction, HSBC is required to enter into a Financial Dispute Resolution Scheme process with you; however, any dispute over the contractual terms of the above insurance product should be resolved between HSBC Life and you directly.<br></p>
